_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan - Executive Summary



Facility:    AGChoice - Osage City

Location:    426 North Third Street, Osage City, KS 

Contact:      Bernard Lickteig, Manager

Phone:             785-528-4632





1. The Facility Policy



MFA Enterprises and the employees of the AGChoice Ammonia Plant in Osage City are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the Osage City Fire Department, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.



2. Facility Information



The primary activity at the facility is the receiving, storage and distribution of anhydrous ammonia for direct application as a crop nutrient as well as dry fertilizer and grain.



The maximum quantity handled would be the unloading of a transport delivery truck holding approximately 50,000 pounds. 



3. The Accidental Release Prevention Program.



We are currently upgrading the facility to the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1, 1999", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc., the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia", and the Kansas Fertilizer Law.



4. The Five-year Accident History



There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that: have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.



5. The Emergency Response Program.



The facility has;



    a. a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA

       Standard, 29 CFR 1910.38;



    b. provided State and Local authorities with the emergency

       planning and community right-to-know information as

       required unde

r SARA Title III (EPCRA);



    c. employees will not respond to any release other than to activate

           an emergency shut-off while evacuating the facility. Local emergency

           responders will be notified to control any release.



6. Planned changes to improve safety.



Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. Currently the facility is evaluating the requirements of CGA 2.1, 2014 and Process Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals and will make the required upgrades needed.







    10/12/12
